title.narrative: Inter-European Aviation Safety Program Management (IEASPM)

description.narrative: The Inter-European Aviation Safety Program Management (IEASPM) Course is intended for personnel (both officer and enlisted) assigned to current or future Flight Safety Officer (FSO) positions. It will provide students with a working knowledge of an aviation mishap prevention.program. Course graduates will be capable of administrating an aircraft mishap prevention.program to include: bird/wildlife aircraft strike hazard (BASH), midair collision avoidance.(MACA), hazardous air traffic reports (HATRs), hazard reporting, inspections, airfield safety, and.disaster response. In addition, the course will also address concepts, methodologies, and best.practices in the area of Risk Management (RM). Each course incorporates visits to active airfields.to observe aviation mishap prevention programs.

title.narrative: U.S. Department of Defense, Institutional Capacity Building Programs: Defense Institution Reform Initiative

description.narrative: Nigeria - Vertically Integrated Logistics Approach #5. Merge the former Security Governance Initiative (SGI) Working Group (working on acquisition and procurement reform) into the Vertically Integrated Logistics Approach (VILA) team for a single focused project. Conduct a 4-day workshop on the status of VILA and SGI Focus Area 2 and facilitate a discussion on defense management activities to ensure the PN has a solid understanding of the three topics.

title.narrative: U.S. Department of Defense, Institutional Capacity Building Programs: Defense Institution Reform Initiative

description.narrative: Nigeria - Vertically Integrated Logistics Approach #6. Improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the supply chains. Improve and enhance the procurement system for Spares and Stores. Service specific focus areas within the Supply Functions objectives: Army Spares supply chain; Navy POL quality assurance; Air Force C-130 sustainment with a view to gaining lessons for A-29 sustainment. Increase capacity of the overall logistics system. Improve coordination between Services logistics functions. Ensure accountability and transparency while achieving standardization. Reduce costs of logistics activities and procurement...
